title: Training Wisteria Vines up a Tree (NON-Invasive Wisteria)(Zone 8b)

tasks.task: Attaching non-invasive wisteria vines to a tree
subtasks: Identifying the tree and checking if it can handle nails
Marking the points on the tree where vines need support
Hammering U-shaped or V-shaped nails into the tree bark to secure vine whips
Ensuring vines are directed upwards towards the tree’s upper branches
Securing longer vine growths by driving nails higher into the tree if necessary
Checking the work for stability and adjusting nail placements as needed

tasks.task: Maintaining non-invasive wisteria growth around a tree
subtasks: Monitoring vine growth throughout the season
Regularly attaching vine whips to the tree as they grow
Evaluating the vine’s health and tree’s condition to ensure compatibility
Preparing for potential tree removal when moving to a new residence
